items.title: Seven in 10 Indian employees carrying at least one lifestyle-related health risk: Survey
items.summary: Seven in 10 Indian employees are found to have at least one lifestyle-related health risk, as highlighted in a new report by MediBuddy and CII. The report emphasizes the evolving healthcare and workplace wellness landscape in India, driven by rising medical costs and a digitally empowered workforce.

items.title: Stocks to Buy | Earnings, Sectors & Risks: Jigar Mistry’s Roadmap for the Next 6 Months
items.summary: Jigar Mistry highlights India's favorable macroeconomic landscape in an interview with ET Now, noting controlled inflation, fiscal deficit, and current account. He provides insights on stocks to buy for the next 6 months.

items.title: Where tech meets culture: 2025 Hainan Southeast Tech & Art Festival to launch July 25
items.summary: Lingshui, a coastal county in southern China's Hainan province, will host the 2025 Hainan Southeast Tech & Art Festival from July 25-27, focused on empowering art with technology and innovation leading the future.

items.title: Wi-Fi 8 detailed, even if it's years away: More stable connections, lower latency
items.summary: Wi-Fi 8, a new standard aiming to provide more stable connections and lower latency, is detailed in a blog post by Qualcomm. The technologies it offers could benefit AI, industrial automation, and advanced wearables.

items.summary: Tech companies like Alphabet, Meta, and Microsoft stand to benefit from Trump's AI action plan as he vows to cut red tape, following millions invested in the industry.

items.summary: With three months to go until Microsoft ends support for Windows 10, Dell and Intel want to convince corporate buyers that upgrading their PC fleet is a virtue and not a necessity.

items.title: Intel Earnings: Chipmaker to cut jobs as Q3 loss forecast deepens
items.summary: Intel plans to cut jobs in an effort to reduce its workforce to 75,000 by year-end, with shares jumping despite a projected steeper third-quarter loss. Sales are expected to surpass estimates, and CEO Lip-Bu Tan is leading a turnaround.

items.title: Intel beats shareholder lawsuit over $32 billion stock plunge
items.summary: Intel beats shareholder lawsuit over $32 billion stock plunge, as a federal judge dismisses claims of shareholder fraud related to issues in its foundry business.

items.title: Digital sovereignty becomes a matter of resilience for Europe

items.title: $1b of Nvidia chips got into China, despite the ban
items.summary: $1b of Nvidia chips got into China, despite the ban - As Jeff Goldblum once said in Jurassic Park: “Life finds a way,” and so do China’s AI demands. At least $1 billion worth of cutting-edge semiconductors have been smuggled into China since President Trump blocked Nvidia chip sales to the country in April.

items.title: Nvidia AI chips worth $1 billion entered China despite US curbs: FT
items.summary: Nvidia AI chips worth $1 billion were smuggled into China despite US restrictions, including banned high-end processors, following tighter export controls. This influx of smuggled products had financial implications for the market.

items.title: From WhatsApp tips to deepfakes: Nilesh Shah warns Gen Z on investment pitfalls
items.summary: Nilesh Shah cautions Gen Z investors about the pitfalls of social media hype and unverified tips, emphasizing the importance of fundamental research and long-term investing.

items.title: Tech giants ramp up AI spending in heated infrastructure race
items.summary: Tech giants are increasing their AI infrastructure spending, with Alphabet raising its 2025 capex to $85 billion. This signals a heated race among technology companies to invest in AI despite uncertain returns.

items.title: Show HN: NeoArchive – Offline Android File Manager with 25 Tools
items.summary: I built an offline-first Android app called NeoArchive that acts as a file manager with 25 tools, including media conversion and PDF splitting. The app works without requiring a login and is optimized for low-end phones, built using Flutter with native plugins for audio/video processing.
